name: EA Ontology (Enterprise Architecture Portfolio)
description: Enterprise Architecture portfolio management ontology extending PPM for initiative tracking, dependency management, strategic pillar alignment, practice area assignment, benefit and effort metrics, and value realisation across multi-year transformation horizons.

components.Portfolio: Collection of programmes delivering strategic vision within an investment envelope
components.Programme: Coherent set of initiatives delivering benefits aligned to a strategic pillar
components.Initiative: Discrete transformation initiative with defined outcomes and dependencies
components.Workstream: Sub-component of initiative for complex delivery management
components.Dependency: Typed relationship between initiatives for sequencing and enablement
components.Milestone: Significant achievement point with success criteria and target date
components.PracticeArea: Business unit or advisory practice contributing to transformation
components.BenefitMetric: Quantified benefit measurement with baseline, target, and actual values
components.EffortMetric: Resource consumption measurement for capacity planning
components.Risk: Identified risk to initiative delivery with probability and impact

crossOntology.name: spawnsFromRecommendation
crossOntology.purpose: GA → EA: Gap analysis recommendations spawn initiatives

crossOntology.name: decomposesToEpic
crossOntology.purpose: EA → EFS: Initiatives decompose into Epics for agile execution

versionHistory.changes: Initial EA ontology consolidating PPM schema extension with strategic framework, advisory portfolio, and initiative data

OAA v6.1.0 upgrade: 18 relationships (14 internal + 4 cross-ontology) forming single connected component, 8 business rules with IF-THEN format, 10 entities as DefinedTerm with properties, 5 enumerations, crossOntologyReferences with keyBridges for VSOM/GA/EFS bridges

notes: EA-ONT extends PPM-ONT for enterprise architecture transformation portfolios. Includes 9 instance data files with strategic framework, advisory portfolio, dependencies, and initiative batches. Bridges VSOM for strategic alignment, GA for recommendations, and EFS for agile decomposition.
